title: VGI Partners Asia fund raising passes $500m
text:
Hedge fund VGI Partners is on track to record the biggest raising for an ASX-listed Asian equities listed fund.

It is understood the manager's proposed new listed investment trust, VGI Partners Asian Investments (VG8), has secured bids worth more than $500 million to ensure it'll hit the ASX boards as planned.

VG8's big broker syndicate has been drumming up interest in recent days, threatening to close the broker firm offer ahead of the October 15 targeted date.

VGI Partners' Robert Luciano and Douglas Tynan are directors on the proposed new Asian equities fund. Nick Moir

VGI is seeking to raise up to $1 billion for the new Asian equities fund.

Having passed the $500 million mark, VGI is on track to close the largest Asian equities listed fund by an Australian manager. The previous biggest was Platinum's Platinum Asia Investments Ltd, which raised $293 million in 2015.
